chess

Class Chess.Piece

  • java.lang.Object
    • chess.Chess.Piece
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    Chess.Bishop, Chess.Black_Pawn, Chess.King, Chess.Knight, Chess.Queen, Chess.Rook, Chess.White_Pawn
    Enclosing class:
    Chess

    public abstract static class Chess.Piece
extends java.lang.Object
    Piece is the abstract class that all pieces will extend and exists so that each piece can be controlled polymorphically, e.g., the main method can say piece.move(), the putsOwnKingInCheck method can say piece.check, etc.

    Each piece must store a String of its name, a char of its file (a-h), an int of its rank (1-8), and a boolean for its side: white_side == true for white or false for black.

    Each piece must also implement a move method, which throws an IllegalArgumentException if the position it is to move to indicated by the parameter is not valid, a check method that checks all the positions the piece can move to to see if it is placing the opponent's King in check, and an allValidMoves method that returns that piece's valid moves

    Author:
    Jake
